channel.title: Syracuse University Public Events occurring between Saturday, October 5, 2024 1:17 PM EDT and Monday, November 4, 2024 12:17 PM EST
channel.description: A listing of public events for Syracuse University occurring between Saturday, October 5, 2024 1:17 PM EDT and Monday, November 4, 2024 12:17 PM EST.

item.title: Rescue Mission Madness
item.description:
Rescue Mission Madness

The Sport Management Club is hosting a 3v3 Basketball Tournament to raise money for the beneficiary of our 20th Annual Charity Sports Auction, the Rescue Mission Alliance of Syracuse! The tournament will take place at 1:30 pm on October 5th at the basketball courts outside the Women's Building. Each team can have between 3-5 players, and it only costs $20 per team to play. Register now and come join us on Oct. 5th! Register at: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdS3C_jYGLz1MlU_w-Mg47SfvhJ-xaeRFwsVXyfoukyx04f3g/viewform 

 

Every year, the Sport Management Club hosts a hybrid-style auction filled with sports memorabilia, and all proceeds go to a CNY non-profit. As part of our fundraising efforts, we are hosting a 3v3 basketball tournament to raise funds that will go directly to Rescue Mission! A little bit more on the Rescue Mission: they are a 501(c)(3) organization that combats food insecurity and homelessness in Onondaga County. To date, they have served 243,631 meals, housed 528 people, and provided 99,657 overnight stays. Help us raise money to support their cause!

From Saturday, October 5, 2024 1:30 PM to 3:00 PM EDT at Women's Building Basketball Courts.

item.title: Apple Picking
item.description:
Apple Picking

Join SPS at Beak and Skiff Apple Picking

 

Contact any of the Eboard members if you need to carpool

From Saturday, October 5, 2024 2:00 PM to 4:00 PM EDT at Beak and Skiff Apple Orchard.

item.title: BFA!
item.description:
BFA!

 Black Box Players presents "BFA!". This brand new musical is written by students, for students. This hilarious new musical explores the lives of theatre students at Barden University. 

Friday, October 4th 8:00pm Tickets

Saturday, October 5th 8:00pm Tickets

From Friday, October 4, 2024 8:00 PM to Saturday, October 5, 2024 8:00 PM EDT at Skybarn.

item.title: Rip the Runway: Land of the Riches
item.description:
Rip the Runway: Land of the Riches

A collaboration between the African Student Union (ASU) and Fashion Design Society (FADS). This fashion show is a high scale event recognizing the beauty and essence of the African diaspora through fashion. Our goal is to highlight African patterns and designs as forms of wealth across the continent to the students at our university. 

From Saturday, October 5, 2024 7:00 PM to 11:00 PM EDT at Goldstein Auditorium.
item.author: fashiondesignsociety@outlook.com (Fashion and Design Society)

item.title: CuseHacks 2024
item.description:
CuseHacks 2024

CuseHacks is Syracuse University’s annual 24-hour hackathon. A hackathon is a technology-centered project competition where students come together to formulate and build innovative applications, websites, and software projects. CuseHacks is open to engineers, designers, inventors, programmers, and dreamers! In addition to working on their project, attendees have the opportunity to meet and network with technology industry representatives, attend educational workshops, and participate in other fun activities. Meals, snacks, and refreshments will be provided to participants throughout the hackathon.

From Saturday, October 5, 2024 11:30 AM to Sunday, October 6, 2024 4:30 PM EDT at Life Science Complex Atrium.
item.author: innovateorange@gmail.com (Innovate Orange)

item.title: Fundraising
item.description:
Fundraising

Learn the basics of planning and executing successful fundraisers, from brainstorming creative ideas, to marketing your event and securing donations. Through hands-on activities and practical tips, you'll gain the confidence and skills needed to rally support for your projects, clubs, or causes. Perfect for student organizations looking to participate in the Fall Student Org Challenge, this workshop will help you turn your vision into reality!

 

RSVP required to attend.

From Monday, October 7, 2024 4:00 PM to 5:00 PM EDT at Schine Student Center, Rm. 304.

item.title: Create your own Street Sign
item.description:
Create your own Street Sign

Join us for a hands-on session creating your very own street sign! Express your creativity and personalize a sign that reflects your unique style. It's a fun way to unleash your imagination and add a personal touch to your space. FIRST COME FIRST SERVE!

From Tuesday, October 8, 2024 1:00 PM to 3:00 PM EDT at Schine Student Center Atrium.

item.title: Pre-Therapy and Allied Health Club Resume Building Workshop with RoQue Harmon
item.description:
Pre-Therapy and Allied Health Club Resume Building Workshop with RoQue Harmon

Join us for our upcoming Resume Workshop on October 8th, with Falk Internship Coordinator RoQue Harmon, the Falk College Internship Coordinator! This workshop is designed to help students in the Pre-Therapy and Allied Health Club develop strong, tailored resumes for careers in physical therapy, occupational therapy, athletic training, physician assistant studies, and other allied health fields.

During this interactive session, attendees will learn essential resume-building techniques, receive personalized feedback, and gain insights into what employers in the healthcare industry are looking for. To create a welcoming and engaging environment, we will be providing refreshments and snacks, to encourage participation and foster networking among attendees.

Don't miss this opportunity to enhance your professional skills and connect with fellow students!

We look forward to seeing you there!

From Tuesday, October 8, 2024 6:30 PM to 7:30 PM EDT at Falk Room 100.
item.author: mreill06@syr.edu (Pre-Therapy and Allied Health Club)

item.title: AIAA Trivia Night
item.description:
AIAA Trivia Night

We will be hosting a trivia night where you will compete against your peers in Aerospace themed trivia! 

 

AIAA is a national technical society that aims to create a community amongst aerospace engineers and enthusiasts, give them a place to further explore their passions, develop career skills, and find other like-minded individuals. 

From Tuesday, October 8, 2024 7:00 PM to 9:00 PM EDT at Lyman 132.

item.title: Unity in Diversity: Arab Student Association Mixer
item.description:
Unity in Diversity: Arab Student Association Mixer

Join us for a fun and friendly mixer hosted by the new Arab Student Association! This event is all about making connections, celebrating & engaging in different Arab cultures, and building a supportive community. Enjoy traditional snacks and engaging activities, while meeting fellow students and E-Board members. Whether you’re new to campus or just want to meet new people, this is the perfect chance to dive into cultural experiences and find out how you can get involved in upcoming events.



 

From Wednesday, October 9, 2024 6:00 PM to 7:00 PM EDT at Hall of Languages 500.
item.category: Ethics, Integrity, and Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

item.title: WINS Guest Speaker series
item.description:
WINS Guest Speaker series

During our meeting in Bowne Hall room 110, we intend to host a speaker event including a Q and A session and networking opportunity for interested students. We have recruited Acting Chief Data and AI Office with Department of the Air Force to address interested students and mentor them on career development. This event will also serve as a social opportunity for interested students and as a new organization will boost our participation. The food will be served before the event during a mingling period and then enjoyed after the panel session while students ask questions.

From Wednesday, October 9, 2024 6:00 PM to 7:00 PM EDT at Bowne Hall 110.
item.author: wins@groups.syr.edu (Women in National Security at Syracuse University )
item.host: Women in National Security at Syracuse University

item.title: Model UN Club General Meeting
item.description:
Model UN Club General Meeting

The Model United Nations Club meets weekly to discuss varied topics of international importance as well as fun fantasy themes from the perspective of diverse countries and parties. We practice a mix of both General Assembly and crisis style committees. Through this club, you will develop the ability to think critically, speak persuasively, and write decisively. It is open to Syracuse and SUNY ESF undergraduate students of any experience level.

This meeting we will focus on the procedures of the United Nations and how we can serve as delegates in Model UN Conferences. We will focus on essential formatting and presentation as well as going over the Robert's Rules of Order. We will practice with some fun speaking activities and exercises.

From Wednesday, October 9, 2024 6:45 PM to 7:45 PM EDT at Eggers Hall 032.
item.author: sgolds07@syr.edu (Model United Nations Club)

item.description:

item.title: MTSU's Trial Advocacy Program Workshop
item.description:
MTSU's Trial Advocacy Program Workshop

MTSU's Trial Advocacy Program will be hosting trial advocacy workshops to train students in advocacy skills! OPEN TO ALL STUDENTS!!

Are you interested in joining MTSU's competitive team, developing their trial advocacy skills, true crime, law, politics, and anything to do with advocacy? Then you should come to our Workshops!

From Wednesday, October 9, 2024 7:00 PM to 8:00 PM EDT at Eggers Hall Room 018.

item.title: Latine Experience at 'Cuse
item.description:
Latine Experience at 'Cuse

The National Association of Latino Fraternal Organizations is excited to host an open panel discussion on our Latine experiences here at Syracuse! Join us on Oct 9, 2024 at 6pm as we talk about the up and downs that make the college experience as a student of color. We hope to see you there! Bring some questions

From Wednesday, October 9, 2024 6:00 PM to 8:00 PM EDT at Schine 304ABC.

item.title: Guest Speaker Event: Christina Coco @ Evercore Investment Bank
item.description:
Guest Speaker Event: Christina Coco @ Evercore Investment Bank

Meet a recent Syracuse Alumni October 9th, in-person or online, and have some questions prepared! (Speaker will be online via Zoom)

Evercore is a premier global independent investment banking advisory firm. Founded in 1995 by Roger Altman, David Offensend, and Austin Beutner, Evercore has advised on over $4.7 trillion worth of merger, acquisition, and restructuring transactions since its inception.

The firm is dedicated to helping clients achieve superior results through trusted, independent, and innovative advice on matters of strategic and financial significance. This includes mergers and acquisitions, strategic shareholder advisory, restructurings, and capital structure. Evercore also assists clients in raising public and private capital, delivers equity research, equity sales, and agency trading execution, and provides wealth and investment management services to high-net-worth individuals.

Evercore is known for its client-focused and values-driven approach, striving to create a culture centered around employee growth, career development, mentorship, and sponsorship.

Speaker Profile: LinkedIn Profile - Christina Coco, Investment Banking Analyst
 

From Wednesday, October 9, 2024 7:00 PM to 8:15 PM EDT at Whitman School of Management 204.
item.author: akioanno@syr.edu (Private Equity club at Syracuse University )
item.host: Private Equity club at Syracuse University

item.title: Black Mamba Skate Night
item.description:
Black Mamba Skate Night

Come and skateboard at the Black Mamba Indoor Skatepark! No experience or skateboard required. Transportation is provided. Students will be picked up from college place at 5 PM and taken back at 8:30 PM. You are welcome to use your own transportation. This event is completely FREE. 

Fill out this form to attend: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSf4HTdghLs99O7KsiYVyNi3AqVvoHLmHqvxltjcq1kMQqAnew/viewform?usp=sf_link

Don't forget to join thr GroupMe for any updates and announcements: https://groupme.com/join_group/93189413/VCzhx9Hp

 

From Thursday, October 10, 2024 5:00 PM to 8:30 PM EDT at 1 Lepage Pl, Syracuse, NY, 13206.

item.title: CliftonStrengths
item.description:
CliftonStrengths

Join the Student Engagement Leadership team on Friday, October 11th, for a leadership development session on Clifton Strengths. Clifton Strengths is an online assessment that reveals students' top five themes of talent and teaches students tips and tricks to make the most of their talents. 

This session is intended for undergraduate students only.

Registration is required - Register for the session here!

10 point value towards the Leadership Challenge.

From Friday, October 11, 2024 2:00 PM to 5:00 PM EDT at Schine Student Center, Rm. 228.

item.title: X-treme Laser Tag
item.description:
X-treme Laser Tag
Prepare for adrenaline-pumping action at our X-treme Laser Tag event! Grab your friends and gear up for an exhilarating battle of strategy and skill in the arena. Navigate through thrilling obstacles, unleash your competitive spirit, and experience the ultimate laser tag adventure. It's high-energy fun that will leave you breathless and craving more!  If you require accommodations, please email oad@syr.edu by 10/2. *MUST RSVP ON 'CUSE ACTIVITIES* FIRST COME FIRST SERVE! 

From Friday, October 11, 2024 10:00 PM to 11:59 PM EDT at Schine Student Center Goldstein Auditorium.

item.title: Game Night
item.description:
Game Night

The Gaming Club at Syracuse University is a club in which all members of the ESF/SU community (students, grad-students, faculty, etc) may come together to share in the love of games. We gather to play all games possible, including but not limited to board, digital, table-top, and live action, in the hopes of bringing together members of our community and further uniting the ESF and SU campuses

From Friday, October 11, 2024 7:00 PM to Saturday, October 12, 2024 12:00 AM EDT at Hinds Hall, Room 011.

item.title: Ethical Volunteering Workshop
item.description:
Ethical Volunteering Workshop

Connect 315 is hosting a workshop to promote ethical volunteering and community engagement amongst our members and any interested students. Workshop will go over What Is Ethical Volunteering, What Is a Community First Perspective, Core Principles of ethical volunteering, and more!!! This training is led by our community liaison, Leah Farrell.

From Saturday, October 12, 2024 11:00 AM to 12:00 PM EDT at Schine 128.
item.category: Ethics, Integrity, and Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

item.title: Murder Mystery Dinner
item.description:
Murder Mystery Dinner

Agent Double Y of Her Majesty’s Service is on another high-stakes mission. Who will make the right moves? Who will be taken off the board? The European crime boss? The Texas-sized American politician? The back-stabbing reporter? Or will Double Y come to the rescue again? You won't want to miss this murdery mystery complete with a delicious meal. Meet at College Place at 5:30PM. If you require accommodations, please email oad@syr.edu by 10/2. *MUST RSVP ON 'CUSE ACTIVITIES* FIRST COME FIRST SERVE! 

 

Visit MyProVenue™ (tickets.com) for transportation and ticketing information. Please note: No backpacks will be allowed in the venue.

From Saturday, October 12, 2024 6:00 PM to 8:00 PM EDT at The Spaghetti Warehouse - 689 N Clinton St, Syracuse, NY 13204.
item.location: The Spaghetti Warehouse - 689 N Clinton St, Syracuse, NY 13204

item.title: The Daisy Project
item.description:
The Daisy Project

Philanthropic event across Gamma Phi Beta internationally to raise awareness for suicide prevention. This year Syracuse's chapter of the national organization if you're reading this will be joining us! 

We will be setting up a table on our porch and will be selling Daisy Project hoodies, stickers, and daisies to symbolize reducing the number of college students who commit suicide each year. All proceeds go towards the American Foundation for Suicide Prevention. 

From Wednesday, October 16, 2024 4:00 PM to Friday, October 18, 2024 4:00 PM EDT at Gamma Phi Beta .

item.title: PhiDE Tissue Box Drive Fundraiser
item.description:
PhiDE Tissue Box Drive Fundraiser

Phi Delta Epsilon will be hosting our annual Tissue Box Drive fundraiser again, where we raise money for our local Children's Miracle Network Hospital, St. Golisanos Children's Hospital!  This event will kick start our Stand for the kids week, a week full of fundraisers for the kids.  Donations will be accepted starting October 13th through October 19th.

CFF Carnival

CFF Carnival is Delta Phi Epsilon's fall philanthropy event to raise money for the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation. There will be a variety of food, games, and other activities for all participants to enjoy. All proceeds will be donated to the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation.

item.title: Theta Bowl - Fall 2024
item.description:
Theta Bowl - Fall 2024

The Chi Chapter of Kappa Alpha Theta will be hosting our fall philanthropy Theta Bowl! We will be having teams sign up to compete in a flag football tournament to raise money for Onondaga CASA and The Kappa Alpha Theta Foundation. Onondaga CASA is a program that connects community volunteers, known as Court Appointed Special Advocates, with neglected and abused foster children. The Kappa Alpha Theta Foundation provides the members of Kappa Alpha Theta funding opportunities so they can embrace their ambition, reach their fullest potential, and make a difference in the world. Please consider donating and attending our event on October 20th from noon to 4 pm.

From Sunday, October 20, 2024 12:00 PM to 4:00 PM EDT at Women's Building Field.
item.author: cusetheta306@gmail.com (Kappa Alpha Theta)

item.title: Life Together: A Community Conversation for Election Season and Beyond
item.description:
Life Together: A Community Conversation for Election Season and Beyond

Do you care about the future of democracy, civic engagement, and civil dialogue? Do you believe our campus community would benefit from meaningful and respectful conversations on important topics, including issues that are relevant to the upcoming presidential election in the USA? If so, we invite you to participate in “Life Together: A Community Conversation for Election Season and Beyond” on October 22nd in the Goldstein Auditorium of the Shine Student Center of Syracuse University. 

This program is part of the 2024-2025 academic year initiative "Life Together: Seeking the Common Good in a Diverse Democracy". Led by Dr. Gretchen Ritter (Vice President for Civic Engagement and Education), along with co-chairs Margaret Talev (Director of the Institute for Democracy, Journalism and Citizenship) and Dr. Tina Nabatchi (Director of the Program for the Advancement of Research on Conflict and Collaboration), and a host of campus partners, our purpose is not to make participants agree, but to alter the way we disagree, so we can live better together as learners, citizens, and leaders.

 

From Tuesday, October 22, 2024 5:45 PM to 8:30 PM EDT at Schine Student Center- Goldstein Auditorium .
item.category: Ethics, Integrity, and Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Students of all ethnic, national and cultural backgrounds are welcome. If you are interested in presenting a topic or leading a discussion, please send a message to the address aemeehan@syr.edu.

item.title: MSA Paint Night
item.description:
MSA Paint Night

As part of our Global Charity Week, SU MSA will host MSA Paint Night. Charity Week is “a volunteer-led campaign that raises money for children in need and orphans around the world. The campaign's goals include:

  • Inspiring young people to be active, socially engaged, and united in their shared Islamic and humanitarian values
  • Demonstrating that unity can solve problems, not money
  • Showing that people are stronger together than apart
  • Providing a lasting solution to the suffering of children through unity

 

The Paint Night event is designed to provide a creative and relaxing experience for students. Participants will gather in a welcoming environment to engage in painting activities, fostering community and friendship among attendees. The event is open to all skill levels, encouraging self-expression through art while promoting inclusivity. All necessary painting supplies will be available for participants. 

Through this fundraising event, we aim to raise awareness and funds for our goal for Chairty Week and unite our efforts to positively impacte lives of those in need, embodying the spirit of generosity and compassion which is central to our values. Additionally, Sadaqah (charity) is a core principle of Islam and this event serves to fulfill one of the obligations of Muslims. 

We will be collecting RSVPs to ensure the headcount is accurate and updated. We will be collecting funds through the Syracuse storefront page to ensure we can track people that donated, etc. This event will provide an opportunity for people in the community to engage with Muslim students and learn more about Muslim faith and cultural practices. This event on campus and open to the entire SU/ESF community. We encourage everyone to to join us in making a difference.  

Last year, MSA hosted "Brushes and Blessings: An MSA Paint Night”. We had a student artist lead the group with painting ideas, while members and non-members joined us for a few hours to use a creative outlet and painted with their colleagues. The event overall went extremely well as it provided a space for participants to relax and connect with their peers while supporting a noble cause. We received great feedback so we are excited to host this event again.

From Friday, October 25, 2024 2:30 PM to 6:00 PM EDT at White Hall - Falk 175.
item.author: msaatsu@gmail.com (Muslim Students' Association)

We gather to play all games possible, including but not limited to board, digital, table-top, and live action, in the hopes of bringing together members of our community and further uniting the ESF and SU campuses

item.title: Best Buddies Friendship Walk
item.description:
Best Buddies Friendship Walk

Join Best Buddies at SU in their second-annual Friendship Satellite Walk! Come together for a morning/afternoon full of games and food, and end the event with a one-mile walk around campus. Best Buddies is an international nonprofit that is dedicated to ending the social, physical, and economic isolation of individuals worldwide with intellectual or developmental disabilities. Through the Friendship Walk, we hope to raise funds to support Best Buddies International's mission and spread awareness about accessibility and inclusivity on the Syracuse University campus and the local Syracuse community. 

From Saturday, October 26, 2024 11:00 AM to 2:00 PM EDT at Women's Building Field.
item.author: bestbuddiesatsu@gmail.com (Best Buddies International at SU)

item.title: MSA Gala
item.description:
MSA Gala

As our grand finale to Global Charity Week, the MSA will host Charity Week Gala. Charity week is “a volunteer-led campaign that raises money for children in need and orphans around the world. The campaign's goals include:

  • Inspiring young people to be active, socially engaged, and united in their shared Islamic and humanitarian values
  • Demonstrating that unity can solve problems, not money
  • Showing that people are stronger together than apart
  • Providing a lasting solution to the suffering of children through unity

MSAs all across the country and even worldwide participate in charity week and compete in raising money for charity week. For the second annual time, MSA will host a formal dinner with a cultural theme, providing the opportunity for each member to dress up in their respective traditional clothing in celebration of our vibrant community. Through this community fundraising chairty dinner, we aim to raise awareness and funds for our goal for Chairty Week and unite our efforts to positively impacte lives of those in need, embodying the spirit of generosity and compassion which is central to our values. Additionally, Sadaqah (charity) is a core principle of Islam and this event serves to fulfill one of the obligations of Muslims.   th

As the second annual charity week gala, attendees will be provided dinner, engaging conversations, and inspiring presentations that highlight the importance of charity work within our community and within the islamic faith. This dinner will also serve as an opportunity for members to donate towards our charity week goal. This is a unique opportunity to connect with fellow students, faculty, and community members while supporting a worthy cause.

We will be collecting RSVPs through Google forms to ensure the headcount is accurate and updated. We will be collecting funds through the Syracuse storefront page to ensure we can track people that donated, etc. This event will provide an opportunity for people in the community to engage with Muslim students and learn more about Muslim faith and cultural practices. Dinner for an event of this caliber and reach is necessary to bring our community together and celebrate our culture and faith. Drumlins is on the SU bus line so this event is accessible and open to the entire SU community. 

As the only formal, and flagship event of the semester, the MSA Gala will be an occasion to dress in each members traditional clothing, celebrate our diverse community, and come together for a night of purpose and communion. This event will be open to all members of SU/ESF. We encourage everyone at Syracuse University to join us in making a difference.  

Last year the Charity Week Gala was a great success and was essential in breaking our previous year’s fundraising record for Charity Week. Each member came dressed in their own traditional cultural clothing/ formal clothing and tons of members took advantage of our photo station to take pictures with their cultural clothing. Then we started the event with our nightly prayer and began the program. The program began by explaining Charity Week and reminiscing on the week of events. The delicious dinner was then served and we resumed the program. The program resumed by sharing the relevance of charity in Islam and included a recitation from one of our members of a verse from the Quran and a translation that pertains to charity. Each board member then shared what charity means to them. We then recognized exceptional community members who have gone above and beyond in community service and charity. The event overall went extremely well and we received lots of amazing feedback so we are excited to host it again. 

From Saturday, October 26, 2024 4:00 PM to 8:00 PM EDT at Drumlins Country Club - Grand Ballroom.
item.author: msaatsu@gmail.com (Muslim Students' Association)

item.title: Orange Appeal Spooktacular 2024
item.description:
Orange Appeal Spooktacular 2024

The event is an A Cappella concert, centered on musical performances by Orange Appeal and other campus A Cappella groups, COVID guidelines permitting. The event will be held on October 26th from 8:00 PM to 10:00 PM in 2024 in Hendricks Chapel. The event will be split in two halves, with about 15 a cappella songs performed by Orange Appeal A Cappella, and a guest group from ACCSU.

We are anticipating a live audience and a live stream for the family and friends of performers who are unable to attend in person. We hope to showcase our members' vast array of talent and the hard work that we put into preparing our setlist. This event is held every October to spread both music and Halloween cheer throughout the campus community. It is a fun and entertaining concert for all music lovers of all ages!

From Saturday, October 26, 2024 8:00 PM to 10:00 PM EDT at Hendricks Chapel.
item.author: orangeappeal44@gmail.com (Orange Appeal)

item.title: Pickleball Tournament
item.description:
Pickleball Tournament

Las Naranjas is hoping to host their first Pickleball Tournament on November 3, 2024. This event will allow the organization to bring together players of different skill levels. We will be focusing on having a diverse community of students, and we will ensure the players to have a good time while enjoying the game.

We will use the Flanagan Gym Basketball courts to put out different nets so that various courts play at once. We will divide the categories in 3; beginner, intermediate, and advanced so we can allow players to play within their category for a fair chance. We will have a winner in each category.

There will be a $5 entry fee per person.

From Sunday, November 3, 2024 10:15 AM to 4:30 PM EST at Flanagan Gymnasium.
item.author: lasnaranjascuse@outlook.com (Las Naranjas)
